content.content: Pale patches on hands, face, and neck that are well-defined and asymptomatic.

content.altText: General skin examination showing vitiligo patches
content.caption: Well-defined pale patches characteristic of vitiligo.

General Skin Examination.interpretation: Findings are consistent with vitiligo, showing classic morphology.

Wood's Lamp Examination.purpose: Enhance lesion contrast under UV light

content.content: Patches exhibit increased brightness under UV light, confirming the diagnosis of vitiligo.

content.caption: Vitiligo patches highlighted under Wood's lamp.

Wood's Lamp Examination.interpretation: Positive Wood's Lamp examination supports the diagnosis of vitiligo.

Dermatological Examination of Mucosa.purpose: Check lips, oral cavity, and genitals for associated lesions

content.content: No depigmented areas observed in mucosal regions; all examinations are normal.

Dermatological Examination of Mucosa.interpretation: Mucosal examination shows no lesions associated with vitiligo.

content.content: No leukotrichia observed in the scalp; hair pigmentation intact.

content.caption: Intact hair with no signs of leukotrichia.

Examine Scalp and Hair.interpretation: Scalp examination is normal, no leukotrichia detected.

Nail Examination.purpose: Evaluate for nail dystrophy (rare in vitiligo)

content.content: Nails are normal with no signs of dystrophy or discoloration.

content.caption: Nails are free from dystrophic changes.

Nail Examination.interpretation: Nail examination shows no abnormalities, ruling out nail involvement in vitiligo.

Check for Signs of Koebner Phenomenon.purpose: Assess for new lesions appearing after skin trauma

content.content: No evidence of new lesions induced by trauma; existing lesions are stable.

Check for Signs of Koebner Phenomenon.interpretation: No Koebner phenomenon observed; lesions are consistent with stable vitiligo.

findings.content: Thyroid palpation reveals no goiter or tenderness; thyroid gland is normal.

Thyroid Palpation.interpretation: Thyroid examination is normal, no signs of autoimmune thyroid disease.

Ophthalmic Examination.purpose: Check for uveitis associated with vitiligo

findings.content: Ophthalmic examination normal with no evidence of uveitis.

Ophthalmic Examination.interpretation: No ocular involvement; eye examination is unremarkable.

Neurological Exam.purpose: Assess for sensory loss to rule out leprosy

findings.content: Neurological examination shows no sensory loss; reflexes normal.

Neurological Exam.interpretation: Neurological assessment normal, ruling out leprosy.

Thyroid Testing.purpose: Screen for autoimmune thyroid disease association
Thyroid Testing.interpretation: Thyroid function tests are normal, no evidence of thyroiditis or metabolic dysfunction.

content.content: Histological examination reveals a complete absence of melanocytes in the depigmented areas.

Skin Biopsy.interpretation: Biopsy findings confirm diagnosis of vitiligo by demonstrating melanocyte absence.

results.content: Under Wood's lamp, affected areas fluoresce bright white, which confirms the diagnosis of vitiligo.

Wood\u2019s Lamp Examination Results.interpretation: Results validate the clinical diagnosis through enhanced visibility of lesions.
